Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer erred in refusing the work permit based on irrelevant considerations or failure to consider relevant evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Assessed through applicant's qualifications and intent to return home
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Applicant's language skills, work experience, job offer details
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Alleged error in visa officer’s evaluation of qualifications and intentions
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Reasonableness of the visa officer's decision
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of English skills, limited warehouse experience, inability to train others
Crimes.Application_Error: Alleged failure to consider relevant evidence or reliance on irrelevant factors
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None found – court held officer properly considered relevant factors
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Visa officer must be satisfied applicant will leave Canada and can perform the job
Crimes.Application_Factor: Language proficiency, job qualifications, intent to comply with conditions
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Existence of reviewable error in refusal decision
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Concerns about ability to perform job and intent to return home
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Contradictions in HRDC stance on English requirements
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Implicitly assessed through qualifications and job match
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to relevance of language and training criteria
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Scope of judicial review of administrative decisions

Crimes.Crime_Name: Work Permit Refusal under Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer erred in refusing the work permit based on irrelevant considerations or ignoring relevant evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Assessed through applicant's qualifications and job suitability
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Language skills, computer literacy, warehouse experience, job requirements
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Allegation that officer ignored relevant evidence or relied on irrelevant criteria
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Inability to speak English, lack of computer skills, limited warehouse experience
Crimes.Application_Error: Claimed disregard of HRDC's position on language requirements
Crimes.Review_Outcome: Dismissed – no certification of general importance
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: HRDC's contradictory stance on language requirements
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Officer must be satisfied applicant can perform work and will leave Canada
Crimes.Application_Factor: Job-related competencies and compliance with entry conditions
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Presence of reviewable error in refusal rationale
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of necessary qualifications and experience as per assessment
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Conflict between HRDC policy and officer’s independent assessment
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Evaluated via consistency of qualifications with job demands
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Argument that language requirement was inconsistently applied
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Extent of deference to administrative decision-makers
